instruction: Create a text summarization of this article. (Provide a link to the article)
output: With spring officially here, citizens of various towns in the South and Midwest are still trying to put their lives back together after a series of tornadoes swept through their communities in March. The path of destruction left behind directly impacted families and their homes, while also disrupting essential public services and infrastructure. Residents are banding together to clean up and rebuild with the help of volunteers and government aid, but the process is slow and expensive.
